title: Varun Dhawan, Arjun Kapoor condemn harassment of Malayalam actress : PTI feed, News - India Today
text:
PTI feed Varun Dhawan, Arjun Kapoor condemn harassment of Malayalam actress Bollywood actors Varun Dhawan and Arjun Kapoor took to Twitter and condemned the harassment incident of a popular Malayalam actress. PTI | Posted by Srivatsan A + A - 
On Friday, a popular Malayalam actress was abducted and molested by a gang of six, who reportedly took pictures of the actor to blackmail her. 
Several Malayalam actors like Mohanlal, Prithviraj, Dulquer Salmaan, Nivin Pauly, Rima Kallingal and Manju Warrier showed their support to the actress. 
Calling the harassment "disgusting", Bollywood actors Arjun Kapoor have condemned the incident. 
Taking it to Twitter, Varun Dhawan wrote, "This is so shameful. Im honestly disgusted. We as a nation and as a society have to answer back." This is so shameful im honestly disgusted. We as a nation and as a society have to answer back https://t.co/01nQWdSovl â€” Varun Badri Dhawan (@Varun_dvn) February 19, 2017 On the other hand, Arjun asked, "How do we make our woman safe??? Does anyone in our government have an answer??? Where does the change lie ?? Through law or through education?" How do we make our woman safe ??? Does anyone in our government have an answer ??? Where does the change lie ?? Thru law or thru education ? https://t.co/qNrN8rnSFo â€” Arjun Kapoor (@arjunk26) February 19, 2017 
While the actor's driver was arrested on the same night, the other two accused were arrested on Sunday in Coimbatore. 
On Sunday, several leading actors of the industry staged a silent protest and expressed their support to the actress.
